Happy Holidays, BounceBit community.

Before the year wraps, we want to say thank you for being part of this with us. You have helped shape BounceBit through 2025 with feedback, support, and daily participation across the ecosystem.

2025 was a year of execution and expansion.

Key moments from 2025:
- V3 launch, a major upgrade to BounceBit‚Äôs core architecture and product set
- Deployments on Base and Solana, expanding our multi chain footprint
- Consistent traction, averaging $450 to $550M in TVL throughout the year

We also validated the Prime direction in a real way. We proved that institutional RWAs can be turned into a scalable onchain yield stack. Prime is anchored by BENJI through our partnership with Franklin Templeton and complemented by BlackRock‚Äôs BUIDL brought onchain in collaboration with Securitize.

Over the last quarter, we stayed focused on fundamentals. Hardening infrastructure, tightening risk controls, and improving transparency so the protocol is ready to scale responsibly. One of the reasons why we were left unharmed on 10/10.

Looking into 2026, the focus stays straightforward:
- Expand institutional distribution
- Keep shipping products that give tokenized assets real utility
- Keep providing real yield on otherwise idle assets

In parallel, we are also gearing up to launch BounceBit Perps - our own perpetuals DEX that will incorporate BB-tokens as collateral and an innovative liquidity pool. We will share more when it is ready.

Christmas update for the community: we are restarting buybacks with 500,000 BB. This is a simple year end signal of alignment and a thank you to everyone building with us.

Enjoy the holidays, take a breather, and come back ready for 2026. We are here, we are building, and execution will define everything from here.

ü§ù Partnership Announcement: @Aidica_xyz √ó @Custodiy1

We‚Äôre proud to announce a strategic partnership between Aidica, a next-generation Solana ICO launchpad focused on vetted, unruggable projects, and Custodiy, a secure smart contract infrastructure for real-world, stablecoin-backed payments.

This collaboration brings trustless payment protection and on-chain contract security to early-stage fundraising, strengthening investor confidence and transparent capital deployment.

üöÄ Aidica: Curated ICOs, real utility, investor cashback rewards
üîê Custodiy: Guaranteed payment contracts, multichain support, compliance-focused design

Together, we‚Äôre setting a higher standard for secure fundraising and investor protection in Web3.

#Partnership #Aidica #Custodiy #Solana #Web3 #ICO #SmartContracts

After $SOL  dropped from $250 to $10, all influencers were writing that $SOL  is a scam and no one was saying to buy.  But when $SOL  reached $150 again, your favorite influencers started claiming it's a gem and we'll soon hit $500, $1,000, and now is the perfect time to buy.  And the same thing will happen with $TON .  In this market, you need to go against the crowd to get the biggest multiples and stay ahead of everyone.  You can keep saying that $TON  is a scam, celebrate TF's mistakes, listen to influencers who only write baseless negativity and insults:  > but will that help you make money?!  Remember, the influencers will change their position again when everything is going well and it benefits them, and you'll be left with nothing and in the same place:)  Just think about it:  > one of the most popular messengers in the world is building and using $TON , and in 2026 the Telegram team will fully engage in working on $TON .  Just remember, we will melt the faces of all the haters and non-believers!

üìä„ÄêXWIN TREND INDEXÔΩúDecember 25, 2025„Äë
Total Score: 34 / 100
 „Éª80‚Äì100 = Strong Uptrend
 „Éª60‚Äì79 = Mild Uptrend
 „Éª40‚Äì59 = Neutral / No Clear Direction
 „Éª20‚Äì39 = Mild Downtrend
 „Éª0‚Äì19 = Strong Downtrend
Direction: ‚ÄúMild Downtrend.‚Äù
One-line comment: ETF outflows and thin liquidity keep downside pressure elevated, but ‚Äúseller exhaustion + a liquidity floor‚Äù are emerging‚Äîmeaning reversals can still happen suddenly.
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
Market Summary
 „ÉªBTC briefly slipped below $87,000; rebounds face heavy resistance around $88,000‚Äì$89,000 (U.S. session selling dominates)
 „ÉªBTC spot ETF flows remain weak (1D: -2,873 BTC, ~-$251M), capping upside
 „ÉªSOL continues to show relatively steady inflows (1D: +36,772 SOL; 7D: +337,249 SOL)
 „ÉªETH saw a small daily bounce (1D: +13,500 ETH) but stays negative on a weekly basis (7D: -54,491 ETH)
 „ÉªXRP-related ETFs keep attracting inflows (latest session: +$8.19M; AUM ~ $1.25B)
 „ÉªYear-end thin liquidity increases wick risk; price action is driven more by liquidations/hedging than ‚Äútrend‚Äù
 „ÉªOptions-driven view points to a ‚Äúmagnet‚Äù pull toward $88k‚Äì$89k, but post-expiry range breaks become more likely
 „ÉªConclusion: Ongoing downside pressure with rebound potential‚Äîtoday is all about flows and options positioning
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
On-chain & Technical Trend
 „ÉªWhale exchange inflows (30D trend) are near cycle-lows, suggesting whale-led sell pressure is gradually drying up
 „ÉªCDD is falling, implying long-term holder (LTH) selling pressure is easing (supply side becomes lighter)
 „ÉªHowever, 7‚Äì10 year-old BTC spending rose (~400 BTC), a signal sometimes seen near distribution/major pivots‚Äîmonitor closely
 „ÉªNetwork activity remains soft; demand recovery often happens before it becomes visible in on-chain data
 „ÉªBTC is still likely range-bound ($85k‚Äì$90k), but post-expiry gamma roll-off can accelerate moves in either direction
 „ÉªETH looks weak on charts (descending-triangle-like structure), but exchange supply is tight‚Äî‚Äúsellable ETH‚Äù is drying up
 „ÉªPost-Fusaka validator declines may be noise, while staked ETH and yield have recovered‚Äînetwork participation is holding up
 „ÉªPriority order: BTC ETF flows > options/gamma & expiry dynamics > exchange flows (whales/LTH) > liquidation spikes > OI/funding
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
Sentiment
 „ÉªFear & Greed stays in ‚ÄúExtreme Fear‚Äù at 24‚Äîpessimism is sticky
 „ÉªLow-volatility phases often compress energy; reversals tend to be sharp rather than gradual
 „ÉªOn a monthly basis, BTC is near an inflection point: ‚Äúhealthy pullback‚Äù vs ‚Äúmore downside if history rhymes‚Äù
 „ÉªDeFi borrowing has dropped sharply (Aave USDT/USDC borrowing down significantly since August), showing leverage demand retreat
 „ÉªMeanwhile, CeFi shows a rebound in ‚Äúborrow against collateral‚Äù behavior‚Äîcentralized lenders absorbing liquidity needs
 „ÉªStablecoin market cap hit a new ATH (~$310B), signaling growing sidelined capital
 „ÉªConclusion: Sentiment is very weak, but seller exhaustion + sidelined liquidity can become rebound fuel
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
U.S. Traditional Markets
 „ÉªS&P 500 is at fresh all-time highs (broad risk-asset backdrop is not broken)
 „ÉªGold also hit new all-time highs (uncertainty premium remains strong‚Äîthis is not pure risk-on)
 „ÉªJanuary FOMC is priced as ‚Äúhold‚Äù (prediction markets ~88%), reinforcing a ‚Äúhigher for longer‚Äù stance
 „ÉªAt the same time, there are signs of liquidity returning in practice‚Äîmacro ‚Äúwater level‚Äù may be rising
 „ÉªGlobal liquidity expansion suggests a potential timing lag before prices reflect the shift
 „ÉªAs long as equities lead, crypto needs ETF/flow improvement to regain sustained bids
 „ÉªConclusion: Macro tailwinds are forming, but crypto remains dominated by ETF flows and supply/demand events
‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï‚Äï
Overall Assessment
BTC remains vulnerable to downside due to ETF outflows and U.S.-session selling, while year-end thin liquidity amplifies wicks and liquidation-driven moves. However, cycle-low whale inflows, falling CDD, and the ongoing build-up in stablecoin liquidity point to ‚Äúseller exhaustion + a liquidity floor,‚Äù increasing the odds of abrupt rebounds. Total score is 34 (mild downtrend).
Key watchpoints today: (1) signs of stabilization or reversal in BTC spot ETF flows, (2) post-expiry gamma roll-off and which direction the range breaks, (3) the $88k‚Äì$89k ‚Äúmagnet‚Äù zone vs downside defense around $85k, and (4) whether diversification flows into SOL/XRP persist or rotate back into BTC.

SOLANA: THE Q4 RESET

Q4 2025 has been Solana‚Äôs toughest quarter of the year.

$SOL is down 39% since October, currently battling to hold the $125‚Äì$130 support zone.

Why the drop? A massive rotation of capital and a cooldown in the "meme coin mania" that fueled Q2 and Q3.

But don‚Äôt let the short-term red candles distract you.

Trading volume just spiked 40.52% to $2.87B in the last 24 hours. The activity is still here.

Incumbent holders are showing resilience, and many are eyeing a massive return to form in 2026.

Price is resetting. Fundamentals are hardening. This is where the long-term entries are built.

ü§î Will Solana hit $1,000 by 2030? Is $SOL still a good investment for the next 5 years? üìâüìà

Fundamentals ‚â† price

Hello Everyone, 

Before listing the updates, it is important to clarify a key technical point üëá

The Solana network is not EVM-based. Unlike networks such as Polygon or BSC, Solana does not use smart contracts in the same format, nor traditional functions like owner or renounce.

On Solana, token control is managed through authorities (Mint Authority and Freeze Authority).

When these authorities are permanently revoked, the token becomes immutable, representing one of the highest levels of on-chain security and transparency.

üìå Current EXD Status

1Ô∏è‚É£ Token created on the Solana network

‚Ä¢ EXD has been officially created on the Solana network.

‚Ä¢ Official Mint Address:
üëâ Avt9g5a5GgvWyYMc9Pd1Gz9Zk4MhVYQuZZmXzSTcGgvZ

2Ô∏è‚É£ Mint Authority REVOKED

‚Ä¢ The Mint Authority has been fully revoked.

‚Ä¢ No new EXD tokens can ever be minted.

‚Ä¢ The token supply is fixed and final.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Freeze Authority REVOKED

‚Ä¢ No wallet can be frozen.

‚Ä¢ There is no administrative function capable of interfering with holders‚Äô balances.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Token set as IMMUTABLE

‚Ä¢ The token has been made immutable.

‚Ä¢ Parameters, rules, and supply cannot be changed.

‚Ä¢ All actions are publicly verifiable on-chain.

üëâ This structure ensures maximum security, full transparency, and economic predictability.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Automatic migration completed (EADX Exchange)

‚Ä¢ The automatic EXD migration to the Solana network has been successfully completed for users holding EXD within the EADX Exchange.

‚Ä¢ EXD deposits and withdrawals on the Solana network are now enabled on the platform.

üîÑ Next step ‚Äî Migration for external wallets

6Ô∏è‚É£ Migration for hot wallets (MetaMask, Trust Wallet, etc.)

‚Ä¢ We are now proceeding with the migration for holders who keep EXD in external wallets.

‚Ä¢ An official migration form will be made available, where holders will:

   ‚Ä¢ Provide the current wallet address
   ‚Ä¢ Provide the Solana wallet address for receiving EXD.

‚Ä¢ After validation, the new EXD tokens will be delivered directly on the Solana network.

üìå All official information, verification links, and ongoing updates are available on the official token page:
üëâ https://t.co/6gGN8YyLy2

We remain fully committed to providing clear, verifiable, and up-to-date information, ensuring that the entire process is conducted in a secure, transparent, and well-structured manner.

2025 saw a structural reset on the NFT market, with flights to fungible liquidity, the decoupling of IP success from asset prices, and a consolidation of volume into revenue-generating verticals.

Here were the major NFT & gaming trends in 2025 üßµ 
1/ In short, NFTs never found a meaningful bid in 2025.

Annualized total trade volume fell to $5.5B, down ~37% compared to 2024.

Chains such as Bitcoin and Solana lost the momentum they built last year, as "multi-chain NFT season" turned into just mostly Ethereum. 
2/ On marketplaces, OpenSea clawed its way back to being the leader, with a 67% market share by year-end as Blur's volume evaporated without aggressive farming rewards. 
3/ Pudgy Penguins were a glimmer of positivity as their IP developments for the year were actually notable, with the launch of @AbstractChain, @pudgypenguins toys in Walmart, an animated YouTube series, etc.
4/ Despite this, Pudgy Penguins provided a harsh lesson on value accrual, as both its NFT floor price and PENGU market cap still tanked by -75% and -60%, respectively.

Emphasizing how mainstream visibility and IP wins don't necessarily translate to positive returns for assets. 
5/ NFT-related projects & product teams stopped pretending every object needed to be an NFT, with many even moving away from them.

@zora pivoted to turning each post into ERC-20s instead of NFTs, while NFT marketplaces leaned more into token swaps + general trading.
6/ Hyperliquid's Hypurr was the cleanest (and arguably only) ‚ÄúNFT as a status layer‚Äù moment for the year.

Instead of an NFT collection launching a token, one of the most dominant DeFi protocols in the space launched an NFT, with its floor hitting ~$80K at peak. 
7/ Pok√©mon TCG platforms quietly showed PMF.

Over $1B in volume and $100M in revenue for the year, showcasing a rare instance where token incentives and gambling mechanics actually aligned with an enthusiastic user base. 
8/ A brief word on crypto gaming, you could technically buy the entire circulating supply of all crypto gaming tokens (~$14b) right now for less than the total VC capital raised for the sector ever (~$19b). 
9/ For a full breakdown of the development and trends of NFTs, gaming and other crypto sectors, check out 2026 Digital Assets Outlook Report by @TheBlock__
